title: Simplify the outline in Font Forge
content:
Hey,  
I have a font which I need to simplify the outline on. That means getting rid of all bezier curve in every single letter and turn them into something similar as the image I've uploaded.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803034130im_/http:/typophile.com/files/a97_4018_3615.jpg)
  
Do you know how to do it in any font software?  
I have access to FontForge and Glyphs. But if you know how to do it in Font Lab or any other software I would be happy to know how.

Any help is very much appreciated :)  
Thank you
author: hamest

comments.content: I discovered this by accident: If you export a TrueType font from FontLab Studio, and import it in Glyphs, you’ll get something like this. I don’t know how to build Glyphs-files in FontForge, but I’d be happy to help you out.
You can do this in FontForge using the Python scripting.
